title: Microsoft DNS - Overview
description: This dashboard categorizes Microsoft DNS Server audit events into various operational groups, allowing security teams to efficiently monitor trends and identify potential threats. The panels are organized into key areas, including Zone Operations, Dynamic Updates Activity, Server Operations, DNSSEC Operations, Configuration Changes, Policy Operations, and Other Operations, each providing targeted insights through dedicated widgets.

definition.content:
**[Microsoft DNS](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/networking/dns/dns-overview)** is a Windows Server service that translates domain names into IP addresses, allowing computers to find and communicate with each other on a network. It supports features like Dynamic DNS (DDNS), zone transfers, conditional forwarding, DNSSEC for security, and scavenging to remove stale records.

This dashboard categorizes Microsoft DNS Server audit events into various operational groups, allowing security teams to efficiently monitor trends and identify potential threats. The panels are organized into key areas, including Zone Operations, Dynamic Updates Activity, Server Operations, DNSSEC Operations, Configuration Changes, Policy Operations, and Other Operations, each providing targeted insights through dedicated widgets.

For more information, see the [Microsoft DNS Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/microsoft_dns/).

**Tip**:
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify and add widgets and visualizations.

Datadog Cloud SIEM analyzes and correlates the Microsoft DNS Server audit events to detect threats to your environment in real time. If you don't see signals please make sure you've enabled [Datadog Cloud SIEM](/security).
